Description: Fragment of Tridacna species clam shell. Probably used as a dish.
Curator's comments: Identified as Tridacna squamosa, though may be T. maxima (Sheila Hamilton-Dyer pers.comm), so Tridacna sp. is a safer identification, especially for fragments.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (WA.09)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.49)
